file_content.text: I bow to your will.
I... concede.
You have slaughtered the best of my men.
You have the better skill. Perhaps it is Alderaan's fate to fall to the Empire.
I will tell my people... we must find a way to live through these times.
Show them that sometimes there is more strength in yielding.
Go. Live. Lead your men.
I will tell my army to stand down. Thank you for this mercy.
No one challenges me and lives.
No. You die.
Then kill me. At least I will not live to see Alderaan fall.
So... you're the Imperial puppet who taught Jorad Thul to bite instead of bark.
Does he lick your hand? Fetch your slippers?
Real Alderaanians will never bow to the likes of you!
No one world can stand up to the might of the Empire.
It's a lost cause.
Yield and you may keep your title and your lands.
Your passion is admirable.
I would sooner see Alderaan blasted into space debris than given over to the Empire.
You don't even have the guts to fight this yourself, instead of hiding behind a carton of thermite.
If you had a shred of decency, you'd settle this by an honorable duel, you against me.
Shut up and die.
Then do it. Another will rise in my place, and another after that, until the last infant child.
If you had a shred of honor, we'd settle this now, you and your people against me and mine.
If you had a shred of decency, you'd settle this like a woman of honor--instead you hide behind a carton of explosives.
If you had a shred of honor, you'd face me like a man of noble blood--instead you hide behind a box of thermite.
Your men against mine.
Fine. Let's duel.
Ah, that's more pride than I would expect in a flock of Imperial vultures.
A duel of skill, then. If your men win, I will tell my house to bow to Jorad Thul.
You against me.
Fine. Let's duel.
You surprise me, bounty hunter. I thought your kind couldn't change their minds unless they're paid to.
You surprise me, Sith. I heard your kind wouldn't know honor if they scraped it off their shoe.
You surprise me. I thought Imperials never fought unless their odds were ten to one.
A duel of skill, then. If you win, I will give my house over to Jorad Thul to use as he will.
If I win, you stand aside and let me cleanse Alderaan of this scourge. And tell your Imperial handlers Alderaan lives free or dies!
To arms!
This tunnel's coming down.
No dice. [Set off explosives.]
Even our ruins are more alive than your Empire!
Retreat!
